scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
in, u, dan, ging, gild, ing, nec, as, cen, sar, sol, tion, es, laps, ar, ly, ings, ble, trac, un, drag, ed, sieged, be, rang, over, warn, cy, i, at

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — cause to feel distressed or worried
B. (4 syllables) — without hope of solution
C. (2 syllables) — That drags.
D. (2 syllables) — based on pretense; deceptively pleasing
E. (3 syllables) — put into a proper or systematic order
F. (3 syllables) — The feeling of being attracted (to something).
G. (2 syllables) — a message informing of danger
H. (6 syllables) — without any necessity
I. (4 syllables) — the state that exists when one person or group has power over another
J. (2 syllables) — a flap that lies over another part

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 11 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
an, suf, girlie, pro, er, ob, rat, gas, bio, ing, tive, si, grasp, kle, mens, chord, er, at, coupe, tech, niques, jec, holt, teth, ly, harp, lif, afp, steep, ing

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — restraint consisting of a rope (or light chain) used to restrain an animal
B. (2 syllables) — DOM: bone
C. (5 syllables) — grow rapidly
D. (1 syllables) — devote (oneself) fully to
E. (2 syllables) — skillfulness in the command of fundamentals deriving from practice and familiarity
F. (3 syllables) — DOM: musical instrument
G. (1 syllables) — the force of workers available
H. (4 syllables) — Without question, without a doubt, definitely, indisputably, not meriting discussion or argument.
I. (1 syllables) — The lair of an animal, especially of an otter.
J. (2 syllables) — Greedy, eager for wealth.
K. (2 syllables) — A mixture of methane and carbon dioxide, produced by anaerobic digestion of organic waste matter, used as a fuel.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 12 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
